title: Gentle Support for Periods: Ayurvedic Teas That Help
author: Harish
excerpt: Discover how Ayurvedic herbs like methi and shatavari ease menstrual discomfort—and when you should see a doctor.
content:
How Ayurveda Understands Menstrual Discomfort

Ayurveda links menstrual cramps and irritability to Vata imbalance in the pelvic region. Warm, grounding herbs help soothe, while nourishing herbs support long-term balance.

Herbs That Help

  • Fenugreek: Warming herb known to reduce cramps.
  • Shatavari: Reproductive tonic supporting hormones.
  • Fennel: Cooling, reduces spasms and bloating.
  • Cinnamon: Improves circulation and warmth.

How to Use Menstrual Tea

Drink 1–2 cups a day during menses, preferably warm. Pair with rest, light foods, and hydration.

When to See a Doctor

If you experience severe pain, heavy bleeding, clotting, or cycle irregularities, consult a gynecologist. Herbal teas are supportive but not a substitute for medical evaluation.
